qas.question: Who took full control of the island after Napoleon's death?
The EIC made what available to the government of the island between 1815 and 1830?
The packet schooner St Helena brought supplies of what to the island?

context: After Napoleon's death, the thousands of temporary visitors were soon withdrawn and the <a0_0>East India Company<a0_0/> resumed full control of Saint Helena. Between 1815 and 1830, the EIC made available to the government of the island <a1_0>the packet schooner St Helena<a1_0/>, which made multiple trips per year between the island and the Cape carrying passengers both ways, and supplies of <a2_0>wine and provisions<a2_0/> back to the island.
